metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized November 7, 2025 - Enhanced CAN-07 guidance, specialized task keywords

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (view pending invitations and prioritize), constraints (focus on this week), and priorities (customer meetings and product strategy).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language input.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the specified timeframe (this week) including invitations and scheduled meetings.
execution_plan.note: Required to access the user's calendar data for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events, focusing on RSVP status to identify pending invitations, and gather details like attendees and meeting titles.
execution_plan.note: Enables filtering for pending invitations and provides context for prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, internal sync) based on metadata and context.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification needed to identify customer and product strategy meetings.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance of each pending invitation relative to user-stated priorities (customer meetings and product strategy).
execution_plan.note: Subjective evaluation to rank meetings by importance.

execution_plan.description: Match pending invitations against the user's explicit priorities for this week to refine prioritization.
execution_plan.note: Ensures alignment with user-defined preferences.

execution_plan.description: Generate a clear, user-friendly display of pending invitations and their priority ranking.
execution_plan.note: Provides the requested 'show me' output in an understandable format.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to basic event titles; if classification fails, show unclassified list with RSVP status.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings this week—flag the ones I need to prep for, and put time on my calendar to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that user wants to flag important meetings for preparation and schedule prep time. Extract constraints: timeframe (this week), action (flag important meetings, schedule prep time).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language input.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all meetings from the user's calendar for the current week to identify which ones might require preparation.
Extract metadata for each meeting such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to help assess preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Enables downstream tasks like importance assessment and prep estimation.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help determine which meetings are likely to require preparation.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to identify which ones are critical and require preparation.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with type classification since both operate on metadata.

execution_plan.description: Estimate the amount of preparation time needed for each flagged important meeting based on complexity, attendees, and attachments.
Check the user's calendar availability to find suitable time slots for preparation sessions before each important meeting.
execution_plan.note: Depends on calendar retrieval and prep time estimation.

execution_plan.description: Create new calendar events for preparation sessions in the identified available slots, ensuring they occur before the corresponding meetings.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If availability checking fails, notify user and suggest manual scheduling; retry calendar updates on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Show me how my meeting time is broken down this month and where I could reclaim time to focus on product development.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: user wants a breakdown of meeting time for the current month and suggestions on reclaiming time for product development.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify timeframe (this month) and optimization goal (focus on product development).

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current month to analyze meeting time distribution.
execution_plan.note: Essential to get the raw data for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata such as attendees, duration, and meeting details from retrieved events to enable classification and analysis.
execution_plan.note: Provides detailed attributes needed for classification and importance assessment.

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by type (1:1, team sync, customer, etc.) to understand how time is allocated across different meeting formats.
execution_plan.note: Helps identify which meeting types consume the most time.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to identify low-value meetings that could be reduced or eliminated.
execution_plan.note: Supports recommendations on where time can be reclaimed.

execution_plan.description: Aggregate total time spent in meetings by type and importance to produce a breakdown for the month.
execution_plan.note: Generates the quantitative basis for visualization and recommendations.

execution_plan.description: Generate personalized suggestions on which meetings to cut or shorten to reclaim time for product development.
execution_plan.note: Provides actionable insights aligned with the user's stated goal.

execution_plan.description: Create visual charts or dashboards showing the breakdown of meeting time and highlight potential reclaimed time opportunities.
execution_plan.note: Fulfills the 'show me' requirement by presenting data visually.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically run sequentially for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, still return textual breakdown and recommendations; retry data retrieval on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Schedule my weekly 1:1 with Alex every Monday at 10am. If there's a conflict, auto-bump movable meetings.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring 1:1), constraints (weekly, Monday 10am), attendee (Alex), and conflict handling rule (auto-bump movable meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language instructions.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'Alex' to a specific contact in the user's directory to ensure correct attendee is invited.
Generate an RRULE for a weekly recurring meeting every Monday at 10am.
Retrieve existing calendar events to check for conflicts with the requested recurring slot.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, RSVP status, and whether meetings are movable or fixed.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify which meetings can be bumped.

execution_plan.description: Classify existing meetings by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync) to help determine which are movable.
Assess the strategic importance and reschedulability of existing meetings to decide which can be bumped.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02A after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Check availability for the recurring slot across the user's calendar and Alex's calendar.
Apply scheduling constraints to fit the new recurring meeting into the calendar, considering conflicts and recurrence.
Resolve conflicts by automatically bumping movable meetings based on importance and type, as per user instruction.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by 'auto-bump movable meetings'.

execution_plan.description: Create the new recurring 1:1 event with Alex at Monday 10am and update any bumped meetings.

parallelization_opportunities: step 6 and step 7 can run in parallel after step 5
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification; if conflict resolution fails, escalate to user for manual decision.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to focus this afternoon. Bump all movable meetings to tomorrow or later this week.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (focus this afternoon), constraints (move all movable meetings), and timeframe (this afternoon → tomorrow or later this week).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify scheduling actions.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for this afternoon and the rest of the week to identify which meetings are candidates for rescheduling.
Extract metadata for each event such as attendees, RSVP status, and any notes to determine reschedulability and constraints.
execution_plan.note: Needed to understand which meetings can be moved and any restrictions.

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by type (1:1, team sync, customer) to help determine which are movable versus fixed.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to decide which ones can be postponed.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02A after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Check availability for tomorrow and later this week to find suitable slots for rescheduled meetings.
Apply scheduling constraints to determine optimal new times for movable meetings based on availability and priorities.
Handle any unsatisfiable constraints or conflicts when rescheduling, performing trade-offs or escalation as needed.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by 'bump all movable meetings' which implies auto-rescheduling and conflict handling.

execution_plan.description: Update the calendar by moving the identified meetings to their new time slots.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after step 3
orchestration.error_handling: If availability check fails, notify user; if conflict resolution cannot find a solution, escalate for manual intervention.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a team sync for next Tuesday at 2pm with Sarah, Mike, and the design team. Book the large conference room and prioritize this over non-customer meetings if there's a conflict.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule a team sync), constraints (next Tuesday at 2pm), attendees (Sarah, Mike, design team), resource requirement (large conference room), and priority rule (prioritize over non-customer meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names (Sarah, Mike) and expand 'design team' into individual members from the directory.
Retrieve existing calendar events for next Tuesday to check for conflicts and availability.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as meeting type, attendees, and importance indicators to support prioritization and conflict resolution.
execution_plan.note: Enables downstream tasks like prioritization and conflict handling.

execution_plan.description: Classify existing meetings into types (e.g., customer, internal, team sync) to apply the prioritization rule.
Assess the strategic importance of existing meetings to determine which can be deprioritized if conflicts occur.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02A as both contribute to prioritization logic.

execution_plan.description: Check availability of all resolved attendees for next Tuesday at 2pm.
Apply scheduling constraints (time, attendees, priority rules) to determine if the requested meeting can be scheduled without conflict.
If conflicts exist, resolve them by deprioritizing non-customer meetings as per user instruction and adjusting schedules if necessary.
execution_plan.note: Handles trade-offs when constraints cannot be satisfied directly.

execution_plan.description: Book the large conference room for the scheduled meeting.
Create the new team sync event with confirmed time, attendees, and booked resource.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 and step 6 can run in parallel after step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If resource booking fails, suggest alternative rooms; if attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification; retry transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull together a prep agenda for my customer pitch on Friday, including recent work updates from the team.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create prep agenda), identify target meeting (customer pitch), date (Friday), and additional requirement (include recent work updates from the team).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for the relevant timeframe (Friday and surrounding days) to locate the customer pitch meeting and any related events.
Classify retrieved events to confirm which one is a customer meeting (customer pitch) to ensure correct context for agenda preparation.
Extract metadata for the identified customer pitch meeting, including attendees, attachments, notes, and any existing agenda items.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and agenda generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments or pre-reads linked to the customer pitch meeting for inclusion in the prep agenda.
Analyze recent collaboration patterns and documents to identify recent work updates from the team relevant to the customer pitch.
execution_plan.note: This step gathers the 'recent work updates' requested by the user.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured prep agenda document that includes meeting details, retrieved attachments, and recent team updates.
execution_plan.note: Final deliverable: a formatted prep agenda for the customer pitch.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (Document Retrieval) and step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with agenda generation using available metadata and updates; retry failed retrievals asynchronously.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull a briefing doc for my 1:1 with Jamie tomorrow, including what we've been working on.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (generate briefing doc), meeting details (1:1 with Jamie), timeframe (tomorrow), and content requirements (include what we've been working on).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the specified timeframe (tomorrow) to locate the 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
Classify retrieved events to identify which are 1:1 meetings, ensuring we select the correct meeting with Jamie.
Extract metadata for the identified 1:1 meeting with Jamie, including attendees, RSVP status, and any attached documents or notes.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and briefing generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments, pre-reads, or shared documents linked to the 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
Analyze past meetings, collaboration patterns, and documents to determine what the user and Jamie have been working on together.
execution_plan.note: Critical for fulfilling the 'including what we've been working on' requirement.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing document for the 1:1 meeting, incorporating meeting details, retrieved documents, and the summary of collaborative work.
execution_plan.note: Final output that satisfies the user request.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (Document Retrieval) and step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with available metadata and work summary; retry failed retrievals where possible.

compositions.prompt_text: Create a summary of all team meetings this quarter and what we accomplished.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create summary), timeframe (this quarter), meeting scope (team meetings), and output requirement (what was accomplished).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events within the current quarter that match the user's calendar data.
execution_plan.note: Needed to gather raw event data for filtering and summarization.

execution_plan.description: Classify retrieved events by meeting type to identify which ones are 'team meetings'.
execution_plan.note: Ensures only team meetings are included in the summary.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata such as attendees, notes, and attachments from the identified team meetings.
execution_plan.note: Provides access to meeting notes and details needed to determine accomplishments.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured summary document of all team meetings and their accomplishments using extracted metadata and notes.
execution_plan.note: Creates the final deliverable summarizing what was accomplished in team meetings.

orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to using event titles and descriptions for summary generation.
